title: [SETUP-BUG] prepare-commit-msg hook not working on Windows

labels.name: area/build
labels.description: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for information on what types of issues we address.

**Please fill in this installation issue template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: latest master branch
- **Python version**: 3.6
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

On a Windows PC, make a commit

```bash
git commit -s -m "my commit message"
```

### Describe the problem
Provide the exact sequence of commands / steps that you executed before running into the problem.

When making a commit, the following error appears:

```bash
error: cannot spawn hooks/prepare-commit-msg: No such file or directory
```

I was able to fix it by adding `#!/bin/sh` at the top of the file. Contributors guide may need to be updated. 

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#common-prerequisites-and-dependencies

I'd be happy to make the fix.

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
